_exec_summary.SummaryText:
2.FACILITY INFORMATION

      THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.

      ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED,STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION. ANNHYDEROUS AMMONIA IS USED FOR CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENTS.

      THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF AMMONIA STORED WOULD BE 380,000 POUNDS IN OUR ONE 30,000 GALLON AND ONE 18,000 GALLON STORAGE TANKS AND NURSE TANKS. THE MAXIMUM QUANITY HANDLED WOULD BE THE UNLOADING OF A TANK TRUCK HOLDING 40,000 POUNDS.

3. THE WORST CASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.

      A. THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF THE TOTAL CONTENTSOF STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OVER A TEN MINUITE PERIOD. THE MAXIMUM QUANITY RELEASED WOULD BE 140,000 POUNDS WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE 30,000 GALLON STORAGE TANK AT 85% CAPICITY AS LIMITED BY MDESIGN STANDARDS. THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT[POINT OF DISPERSION TO 220PPM] IS 1.12 MILES.

      B. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO FOR ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA BASED ON THE HAZARD REVIEW IS A TWO MINUITE RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A 3 INCH PIPE.  THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT[POINT OF DISPERSION TO 220PPM] IS .78 MILES.

4.  THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PROGRAM.

      THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA,K-61.1" PUBLISHED BY THE AMERCIAN NATIONAL INSTITUTE INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALT ADMINISTRATION[OSHA],29CFR1910.111.

5.THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

     A. THERE HAVE NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA IN THE LAST FIVE YEARSTHAT;  
          HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURIES OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY;NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATH, INJURIES,EVACUATIONS,SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR ENVIRONMENTALDAMAGE.

6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

        THE FACILITY HAS;
     A. WRITTEN EMERGANCY ACTION PLAN,IN ACCORDANCE WIT

H OSHA STANDARD,29CFR1910.38;
     B.PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORTIES WITH THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITTLE lll[EPCRA].

     C. COORDINATE WITH THE LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS.

7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

     SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PEROIDIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTAINANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDEROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECCOMMENDATIONS AT THIS TIME.
